docs.title: Thank You!
docs.text: Your contributions make tgdl better for everyone. We appreciate your time and effort! 💙

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Common questions and answers about tgdl.

docs.title: What is tgdl?
docs.text: tgdl is a command-line tool for downloading media files (photos, videos, audio, documents) from Telegram channels, groups, and bot chats.

docs.title: Is tgdl free?
docs.text: Yes, tgdl is completely free and open-source under the MIT license.

docs.title: Is it safe to use?
docs.text: Yes. tgdl: - Uses official Telegram API - Stores credentials encrypted locally - Never sends your data anywhere except Telegram - Open source (you can audit the code)

docs.title: Do I need Telegram Premium?
docs.text: No. tgdl works with free Telegram accounts.

docs.title: Which Python version do I need?
docs.text:
Python 3.7 or higher.

Check your version: 

python --version

docs.title: Can I use tgdl on Windows?
docs.text: Yes! tgdl works on: - Windows 10/11 - Linux (all distributions) - macOS

docs.title: Do I need to install Telegram Desktop?
docs.text: No. tgdl is independent of Telegram Desktop. However, you need: - A Telegram account (with phone number) - Access to Telegram (app or web) to receive verification codes

docs.title: How do I update tgdl?
docs.text: pip install --upgrade tgdl

docs.title: Why do I need API credentials?
docs.text: Telegram requires all API applications to have unique API ID and Hash. This identifies your application to Telegram's servers.

docs.title: Where do I get API credentials?
docs.text:
1. Go to https://my.telegram.org/apps
  2. Login with your phone number
  3. Create an app (if you haven't)
  4. Copy API ID and Hash

Detailed guide

docs.title: Can I share my API credentials?
docs.text:
No! Your API credentials are: - Personal to you - Should never be shared - Used to identify your API usage

Sharing them could: - Allow others to make API calls as you - Risk account suspension if misused

docs.title: What if I lose my API credentials?
docs.text: You can always retrieve them: 1. Go to https://my.telegram.org/apps 2. Login 3. View your existing app 4. Copy credentials again

docs.title: Can I use someone else's API credentials?
docs.text:
No. This violates Telegram's Terms of Service and could result in: - Account suspension - API ban - Security risks

Always use your own credentials.

docs.title: How does authentication work?
docs.text:
1. First time:
  2. Enter API credentials
  3. Enter phone number
  4. Receive verification code in Telegram
  5. Enter code

  6. Session created

  7. After first time:

  8. Session file is saved (~/.tgdl/tgdl.session)
  9. No login needed until session expires

docs.title: How long does a session last?
docs.text: Telegram sessions typically last indefinitely unless: - You explicitly logout - Telegram revokes session (rare) - You remove session files

docs.title: Can I use multiple accounts?
docs.text:
Not directly with current version. Workaround:

# Save session for account 1
cp ~/.tgdl/tgdl.session ~/.tgdl/account1.session

# Login to account 2
tgdl logout
tgdl login

# Switch back to account 1
cp ~/.tgdl/account1.session ~/.tgdl/tgdl.session

docs.title: Is my session secure?
docs.text:
Yes: - Telegram uses encryption - Session file is stored locally - Only you can access it (file permissions) - Encrypted credentials storage

Security tips: - Don't share session files - Keep ~/.tgdl/ directory private - Use tgdl logout on shared computers

docs.title: What happens if I logout?
docs.text: When you run tgdl logout: - Session file is deleted - API credentials are removed - Progress tracking is kept - Downloaded files are NOT deleted

docs.title: Where are files downloaded?
docs.text:
Default location: 

downloads/entity_{ID}/

Example: 

downloads/entity_1234567890/
├── 12345.jpg
├── 12346.mp4
└── 12347.pdf

Custom location: 

tgdl download -c 1234567890 -o /path/to/folder

docs.title: How are files named?
docs.text:
Files are named: {message_id}.{extension}

Examples: - 12345.jpg - Photo from message 12345 - 12346.mp4 - Video from message 12346 - 12347.pdf - Document from message 12347

Why message ID? - Unique identifier - Prevents duplicates - Easy to track

docs.title: Can I download from private channels?
docs.text:
Yes, but you must be a member of the private channel.

Steps: 1. Join channel in Telegram app 2. Run tgdl channels to verify it's listed 3. Download: tgdl download -c {ID}

docs.title: Can I download from public channels I'm not a member of?
docs.text: No. You must join the channel first, even if it's public.

docs.title: How do I download from a group?
docs.text:
# List groups
tgdl groups

# Download from group
tgdl download -g {GROUP_ID}

Use -g flag (not -c) for groups.

docs.title: Can I download specific messages?
docs.text:
Yes, using message ID ranges:

# Messages 20-100
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 20 --max-id 100

# Single message
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 50 --max-id 50

# Or use direct link
tgdl download-link https://t.me/channel/50

docs.title: Does tgdl skip already downloaded files?
docs.text: Yes! tgdl automatically: 1. Checks existing files in download directory 2. Extracts message IDs from filenames 3. Skips messages that are already downloaded 4. Only downloads new files

docs.title: Can I resume interrupted downloads?
docs.text:
Yes. Just run the same command again: 

tgdl download -c 1234567890

tgdl will: - Skip files completely downloaded - Continue from where it stopped

docs.title: How does progress tracking work?
docs.text:
tgdl remembers the last downloaded message ID for each entity in: 

~/.tgdl/progress.json

Example: 

{
  "1234567890": 12345
}

This means: "For channel 1234567890, we've downloaded up to message 12345."

Next download will start from message 12346.

docs.title: Can I reset progress?
docs.text:
Yes:

# Reset all progress
echo "{}" > ~/.tgdl/progress.json

# Or delete the file
rm ~/.tgdl/progress.json

Next download will start from the beginning.

docs.title: Why are some files not downloading?
docs.text:
Possible reasons:

  1. Not media files:

  2. Text-only messages don't download

  3. Filters:

  4. Check your size/type filters

  5. Try without filters: tgdl download -c ID --limit 5

  6. Already downloaded:

  7. Check for "skipping" message in output

  8. Private channel:

  9. You must be a member

  10. File was deleted:

  11. Original message may have been deleted

docs.title: Can I download all messages at once?
docs.text:
tgdl downloads in batches for efficiency:

# Default: Downloads all available
tgdl download -c 1234567890

# With limit
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 1000

docs.title: How fast is download speed?
docs.text:
Speed depends on: - Your internet connection - Telegram server load - File sizes - Concurrent downloads setting

Optimize speed: 

# Faster (more parallel downloads)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 10

docs.title: What media types can I filter?
docs.text:
• -p or --photos - Photos/images
  • -v or --videos - Video files
  • -a or --audio - Audio/music
  • -d or --documents - Documents/files

docs.title: Can I download only photos?
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p

docs.title: Can I download multiple types?
docs.text:
Yes: 

# Photos and videos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -v

# Everything except videos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -a -d

docs.title: Can I filter by file size?
docs.text:
Yes: 

# Maximum size
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 100MB

# Minimum size
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 10MB

# Range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 10MB --max-size 100MB

docs.title: What size units are supported?
docs.text:
• B - Bytes
  • KB - Kilobytes
  • MB - Megabytes
  • GB - Gigabytes
  • TB - Terabytes

Case sensitive: Use MB not mb

docs.title: Can I limit the number of downloads?
docs.text:
Yes: 

# Download only first 50 files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 50

docs.title: How many files can tgdl download at once?
docs.text:
Default: 5 concurrent downloads Maximum: 50 concurrent downloads

# Adjust with --concurrent flag
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 10

docs.title: Should I increase concurrent downloads?
docs.text:
Depends on your connection: - Slow (< 10 Mbps): Use 1-3 - Medium (10-50 Mbps): Use 5-10 - Fast (> 50 Mbps): Use 10-20

Higher isn't always better: - Can trigger rate limits - May overwhelm connection - Can cause timeouts

docs.title: Why am I getting FloodWaitError?
docs.text:
Cause: Too many requests to Telegram servers

Solutions: - Reduce --concurrent value - Add delays between downloads - Wait the specified time before retrying

docs.title: Can I run multiple tgdl instances?
docs.text:
Not recommended. This can: - Trigger rate limits - Cause FloodWaitError - Download duplicates

Run one instance at a time.

docs.title: How much storage do I need?
docs.text:
Depends on: - Number of messages in channel - File sizes - Media types

Check channel size: 

# Test with limit
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 10

# Check downloaded size
du -sh downloads/entity_1234567890/

Use filters to control: 

# Limit size
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 50MB --limit 100

docs.title: Where does tgdl store config files?
docs.text:
Linux/macOS: ~/.tgdl/ Windows: %USERPROFILE%\.tgdl\

Files: - config.json - Encrypted API credentials - .key - Encryption key - tgdl.session - Telegram session - progress.json - Download progress

docs.title: Can I change the download location?
docs.text:
Yes: 

tgdl download -c 1234567890 -o /custom/path

Default: downloads/entity_{ID}/ in current directory

docs.title: Can I delete config files safely?
docs.text:
Delete these ONLY if you know what you're doing:

Safe to delete (will need to login again): - config.json - .key - tgdl.session*

Safe to delete (will re-download from beginning): - progress.json

DO NOT delete if you want to keep: - Downloaded files (in downloads/)

docs.title: What does "Could not find the input entity" mean?
docs.text:
Cause: You're not a member of the channel/group

Solution: 1. Join channel in Telegram app 2. Verify: tgdl channels 3. Try download again

docs.title: What does "Session expired" mean?
docs.text:
Cause: Your session is no longer valid

Solution: 

tgdl logout
tgdl login

docs.title: What does "API_ID_INVALID" mean?
docs.text:
Cause: Wrong API credentials

Solution: 1. Verify credentials at https://my.telegram.org/apps 2. Logout and login with correct credentials

docs.title: Why do I get "No files downloaded"?
docs.text:
Common reasons:

  1. No media in channel:

  2. Channel only has text messages

  3. Filters too restrictive:

  4. Try: tgdl download -c ID --limit 5

  5. All files already downloaded:

  6. Normal behavior if nothing new

  7. Wrong entity type:

  8. Use -g for groups, -c for channels

  9. Not a member:

  10. Join channel first

docs.title: Can I schedule automatic downloads?
docs.text:
Yes!

Linux/macOS (cron): 

# Edit crontab
crontab -e

# Add daily download at 2 AM
0 2 * * * cd /path/to/dir && tgdl download -c 1234567890

Windows (Task Scheduler): 1. Create batch file with tgdl command 2. Schedule in Task Scheduler

Learn more

docs.title: Can I download from multiple channels automatically?
docs.text:
Yes:

Create script: 

#!/bin/bash
tgdl download -c 1234567890
tgdl download -c 9876543210
tgdl download -g 1122334455

Schedule with cron or Task Scheduler.

docs.title: tgdl vs Telegram Desktop export?
docs.text: Feature tgdl Telegram Desktop Command-line ✅ ❌ Automation ✅ ❌ Filtering ✅ Limited Resume support ✅ ✅ Progress tracking ✅ ❌ Cross-platform ✅ ✅ GUI ❌ ✅

docs.title: tgdl vs other downloaders?
docs.text: Advantages of tgdl: - Official Telegram API (safe) - Automatic duplicate skip - Progress tracking - Flexible filtering - Open source - Cross-platform - Resume support - Message ID-based downloads

docs.title: Is tgdl tracking me?
docs.text: No. tgdl: - Does not collect any analytics - Does not send data anywhere (except Telegram API) - Does not phone home - Is completely open source

docs.title: Can others see I'm using tgdl?
docs.text: No. To Telegram, tgdl appears as a regular client. Others cannot tell you're using tgdl specifically.

docs.title: Does tgdl share my data?
docs.text: No. All data stays local: - API credentials (encrypted locally) - Session file (local only) - Downloaded files (local only)

docs.title: Should I use VPN with tgdl?
docs.text:
Optional, but consider if: - Telegram is blocked in your region - You want extra privacy - You're downloading sensitive content

tgdl works fine without VPN in most regions.

docs.title: tgdl command not found?
docs.text:
pip install --user tgdl
# Or
python -m tgdl

docs.title: Permission denied error?
docs.text:
# Install in user directory
pip install --user tgdl

# Or use virtual environment
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install tgdl

docs.title: Download is slow?
docs.text:
# Try adjusting concurrent downloads
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 10

docs.title: Getting timeouts?
docs.text:
# Reduce concurrent downloads
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 3

docs.title: Still Have Questions?
docs.text:
• Check Troubleshooting Guide
  • Read Command Reference
  • View Advanced Usage
  • Report Issue on GitHub

docs.title: Quick Tips
docs.text:
Getting Started

# 1. Login
tgdl login

# 2. List channels
tgdl channels

# 3. Download
tgdl download -c ID

Test Before Bulk Download

# Try with small limit first
tgdl download -c ID --limit 5

Optimize Speed

# Faster downloads on good connection
tgdl download -c ID --concurrent 10

Save Storage

# Use size limits
tgdl download -c ID --max-size 100MB

Automate

# Add to cron for daily updates
0 2 * * * tgdl download -c ID

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide will help you install tgdl on your system.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Before installing tgdl, ensure you have:

  • Python 3.7 or higher installed
  • pip package manager
  • Internet connection

docs.title: Method 1: Install from PyPI (Recommended)
docs.text:
The easiest way to install tgdl is using pip:

pip install tgdl

docs.title: Method 2: Install with pipx (Isolated)
docs.text:
For a cleaner installation that doesn't interfere with system packages:

# Install pipx first (if not already installed)
pip install pipx
pipx ensurepath

# Install tgdl
pipx install tgdl

docs.title: Method 3: Install from Source
docs.text:
For the latest development version:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/kavidu-dilhara/tgdl.git
cd tgdl

# Install in development mode
pip install -e .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
After installation, verify that tgdl is installed correctly:

tgdl --version

You should see the version number:

tgdl, version 1.1.4

docs.title: Platform-Specific Instructions
docs.text:
WindowsLinuxmacOS

Using Command Prompt or PowerShell:

# Install
pip install tgdl

# Verify
tgdl --version

Windows PATH

If tgdl command is not found, add Python Scripts directory to PATH: 

C:\Users\<YourUsername>\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python3x\Scripts\

Using terminal:

# Install for current user
pip install --user tgdl

# Or system-wide (requires sudo)
sudo pip install tgdl

# Verify
tgdl --version

Add to PATH

If command not found, add to your ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc: 

export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"

Using terminal:

# Install
pip3 install tgdl

# Verify
tgdl --version

Homebrew Python

If using Homebrew Python, pip3 is recommended over pip.

docs.title: Virtual Environment (Optional)
docs.text:
For isolated installation:

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv telegram-downloader
source telegram-downloader/bin/activate  # Linux/macOS
# or
telegram-downloader\Scripts\activate  # Windows

# Install tgdl
pip install tgdl

docs.title: Updating tgdl
docs.text:
To update to the latest version:

pip install --upgrade tgdl

To update to a specific version:

pip install tgdl==1.1.4

docs.title: Uninstallation
docs.text:
To remove tgdl:

pip uninstall tgdl

Data Preservation

Uninstalling tgdl does NOT delete:

  • Your configuration files (~/.tgdl/)
  • Your downloaded files (downloads/)
  • Your session data

To remove these manually, delete the .tgdl folder in your home directory.

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
tgdl automatically installs these dependencies:

  • telethon (>=1.42.0) - Telegram client library
  • click (>=8.3.0) - CLI framework
  • tqdm (>=4.67.1) - Progress bars
  • aiofiles (>=25.1.0) - Async file operations
  • cryptography (>=43.0.0) - Credential encryption

docs.title: Issue: pip command not found
docs.text:
Solution: Install pip first:

# Linux/macOS
python -m ensurepip --upgrade

# Windows
py -m ensurepip --upgrade

docs.title: Issue: Permission denied
docs.text:
Solution: Install for user only:

pip install --user tgdl

docs.title: Issue: Command not found after installation
docs.text: Solution: Add Python scripts directory to PATH (see platform-specific instructions above).

docs.title: Issue: SSL Certificate Error
docs.text:
Solution: Update pip and certificates:

pip install --upgrade pip certifi

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that tgdl is installed, you need to:

  1. Get Telegram API credentials
  2. Complete the quick start guide
  3. Learn about authentication

Installation Complete!

You're ready to start using tgdl! Continue to the Quick Start guide.

docs.title: Media Filters
docs.text: Complete guide to filtering media files during download.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: tgdl supports filtering by: - Media type (photos, videos, audio, documents) - File size (min/max) - Message ID range (min/max) - Download limit (first N files)

docs.title: Available Types
docs.text:
Flag Type Includes -p or --photos Photos JPG, PNG, WebP images -v or --videos Videos MP4, MKV, AVI, MOV files -a or --audio Audio MP3, M4A, OGG, FLAC files -d or --documents Documents PDF, ZIP, TXT, any file type

Document Type

Documents include ALL file types that aren't photos, videos, or audio. This includes PDFs, ZIPs, APKs, executables, archives, etc.

docs.title: Single Type
docs.text:
# Photos only
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p

# Videos only
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v

# Audio only
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -a

# Documents only
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -d

docs.title: Multiple Types
docs.text:
# Photos and videos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -v

# Audio and documents
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -a -d

# Everything except videos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -a -d

# Everything (no filter)
tgdl download -c 1234567890

docs.title: Download Profile Pictures
docs.text:
# Channels often have photos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p

docs.title: Video Archive
docs.text:
# Video channels
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v

docs.title: Music Collection
docs.text:
# Music channels
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -a

docs.title: Software/APKs
docs.text:
# App sharing channels
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -d

docs.title: Size Units
docs.text:
Supported units: - B - Bytes - KB - Kilobytes (1024 B) - MB - Megabytes (1024 KB) - GB - Gigabytes (1024 MB) - TB - Terabytes (1024 GB)

Case Sensitive

Use uppercase: MB not mb

docs.title: Maximum Size
docs.text:
# Max 10MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 10MB

# Max 100MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 100MB

# Max 1GB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 1GB

Use cases: - Limited storage space - Bandwidth concerns - Quick downloads only - Filter out large videos

docs.title: Minimum Size
docs.text:
# Min 1MB (skip small files)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 1MB

# Min 10MB (only large files)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 10MB

# Min 100MB (very large files only)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 100MB

Use cases: - Skip thumbnails/previews - High quality content only - Avoid compressed versions

docs.title: Size Range
docs.text:
# Between 1MB and 100MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 1MB --max-size 100MB

# Between 10MB and 1GB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 10MB --max-size 1GB

# Medium-sized files only (5-50MB)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 5MB --max-size 50MB

Use cases: - Specific quality range - Storage budget - Network limitations

docs.title: Quick Download (Small Files)
docs.text:
# Under 5MB (fast)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 5MB

docs.title: Skip Previews
docs.text:
# Over 1MB (skip thumbnails)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-size 1MB

docs.title: Storage Budget
docs.text:
# 50 files under 20MB each = ~1GB total
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 20MB --limit 50

docs.title: High Quality Videos
docs.text:
# Videos over 50MB (likely HD)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --min-size 50MB

docs.title: Avoid Huge Files
docs.text:
# Under 500MB (avoid 4K videos)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 500MB

docs.title: Basics
docs.text:
Message IDs are sequential numbers assigned by Telegram.

Message 1 - Oldest
Message 2
Message 3
...
Message N - Newest

docs.title: Minimum ID
docs.text:
# From message 100 onwards
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100

# Recent messages only (if latest is 1000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 900

Use cases: - Skip old content - Get recent additions - Resume from specific point

docs.title: Maximum ID
docs.text:
# Up to message 100
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 100

# First 50 messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 50

Use cases: - Get old content only - Archive historical messages - Stop at specific point

docs.title: ID Range
docs.text:
# Messages 100-200
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200

# Specific section (500-600)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 500 --max-id 600

# Single message
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 12345 --max-id 12345

Use cases: - Download specific period - Re-download failed range - Targeted backup

docs.title: Finding Message IDs
docs.text:
Method 1: Telegram Desktop 1. Right-click message 2. "Copy Message Link" 3. Link format: https://t.me/channel/12345 4. Last number is message ID

Method 2: From Downloads 

# Filename is message_id.extension
ls downloads/entity_1234567890/
# Output: 12345.jpg, 12346.mp4, etc.

Method 3: Use download-link 

# Download single message to see its ID
tgdl download-link https://t.me/channel/12345
# Downloads 12345.ext

docs.title: Archive Old Content
docs.text:
# First 1000 messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 1000

docs.title: Get Recent Updates
docs.text:
# Last 100 messages (if latest is 5000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 4900

docs.title: Re-download Failed Range
docs.text:
# Had errors in messages 2000-2100
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 2000 --max-id 2100

docs.title: Monthly Archives
docs.text:
# January messages (1-1000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1 --max-id 1000 -o ~/Archives/Jan

# February messages (1001-2000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1001 --max-id 2000 -o ~/Archives/Feb

docs.title: Limit Count
docs.text:
# First 10 files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 10

# First 50 files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 50

# First 100 files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 100

How Limit Works

Limit applies AFTER all other filters:

  1. Filter by message ID range
  2. Filter by media type
  3. Filter by file size
  4. Apply limit to remaining files

docs.title: Quick Preview
docs.text:
# See first 5 files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

docs.title: Test Filters
docs.text:
# Test if filter works
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 10MB --limit 3

docs.title: Storage Budget
docs.text:
# Get 20 videos under 50MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 50MB --limit 20

docs.title: Sample Collection
docs.text:
# 10 random photos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p --limit 10

docs.title: Filter Execution Order
docs.text:
1. Message ID range - Which messages to consider
  2. Media type - Filter by photo/video/audio/document
  3. File size - Filter by size constraints
  4. Limit - Take first N after all filters

docs.title: Small Photos Only
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p --max-size 5MB

docs.title: Recent Large Videos
docs.text:
# Last 50 messages, videos over 100MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1950 -v --min-size 100MB

docs.title: Limited Music Collection
docs.text:
# First 50 audio files under 10MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -a --max-size 10MB --limit 50

docs.title: Specific Range, Specific Type
docs.text:
# Messages 100-200, videos only, under 50MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200 -v --max-size 50MB

docs.title: Everything Except Large Videos
docs.text:
# Photos, audio, documents, and small videos
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -a -d
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 10MB

docs.title: High-Quality Recent Videos
docs.text:
# Last 100 messages, videos, 50-500MB (HD quality)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 \
  --min-id 1900 \
  -v \
  --min-size 50MB \
  --max-size 500MB \
  --limit 20

docs.title: Quick Photo Gallery
docs.text:
# First 50 photos under 2MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 \
  -p \
  --max-size 2MB \
  --limit 50 \
  -o ~/Pictures/Gallery

docs.title: Document Archive (No Large Files)
docs.text:
# All documents under 100MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 \
  -d \
  --max-size 100MB \
  -o ~/Documents/Archive

docs.title: Music Playlist
docs.text:
# 100 audio files, 2-10MB each
tgdl download -c 1234567890 \
  -a \
  --min-size 2MB \
  --max-size 10MB \
  --limit 100 \
  -o ~/Music/Telegram

docs.title: Fast Filters
docs.text:
These are checked before download: - Message ID range - Media type - File size

Result: Very fast, no bandwidth wasted

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 10MB

Process: 1. Fetch message list (fast) 2. Filter: Keep only video messages 3. Filter: Check size (from message metadata) 4. Download only matching files

Advantage: Doesn't download files to check size!

docs.title: 1. Start Broad, Then Narrow
docs.text:
Iterative Filtering

# Step 1: See what's there
tgdl channels

# Step 2: Small test
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

# Step 3: Check file types
ls downloads/entity_1234567890/

# Step 4: Apply appropriate filter
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 100MB

docs.title: 2. Use Limit for Testing
docs.text:
Test First

# Test filter with limit
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 50MB --limit 3

# If results look good, run full download
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 50MB

docs.title: 3. Combine Size and Type
docs.text:
Precision Filtering

# Instead of downloading all then deleting
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --max-size 100MB

# Better than:
# tgdl download -c 1234567890
# (then manually delete non-videos and large files)

docs.title: 4. Use Range for Updates
docs.text:
Incremental Downloads

# First run: Get everything
tgdl download -c 1234567890
# Downloads messages 1-1000, progress saved

# Later: Get new content only
tgdl download -c 1234567890
# Automatically gets messages 1001+

docs.title: 5. Budget Your Storage
docs.text:
Calculate Before Downloading

# Want ~1GB of content
# Max 20MB per file
# = ~50 files

tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 20MB --limit 50

docs.title: No Files Downloaded
docs.text:
Symptom: 

⚠ No files downloaded.

Possible causes:

  1. Filters too restrictive 

    # Try without filters
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

  2. No media in range 

    # Try broader range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1

  3. Wrong media type 

    # Try all types
tgdl download -c 1234567890

  4. Size constraint too strict 

    # Try without size limits
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

docs.title: Unexpected File Types
docs.text:
Symptom: Got documents instead of videos

Cause: Telegram categorization

Solution: 

# Be explicit with type
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v  # Videos only

# Or check media info
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 1
ls -lh downloads/entity_1234567890/

docs.title: Size Limit Not Working
docs.text:
Symptom: Downloaded files larger than max-size

Cause: Size in message metadata may differ slightly

Note: tgdl uses size from Telegram's metadata, which is usually accurate but may have small variations.

docs.title: Quick Reference Table
docs.text: Filter Flag Example Effect Photos -p tgdl download -c ID -p Only photos Videos -v tgdl download -c ID -v Only videos Audio -a tgdl download -c ID -a Only audio Documents -d tgdl download -c ID -d Only documents Max Size --max-size --max-size 100MB Files ≤ 100MB Min Size --min-size --min-size 10MB Files ≥ 10MB Min ID --min-id --min-id 100 Messages ≥ 100 Max ID --max-id --max-id 200 Messages ≤ 200 Limit --limit --limit 50 First 50 files

docs.title: Filter Combinations
docs.text:
# Template
tgdl download \
  -c|g|b ID \
  [-p] [-v] [-a] [-d] \
  [--min-size SIZE] [--max-size SIZE] \
  [--min-id ID] [--max-id ID] \
  [--limit N]

Examples: 

# Photos under 5MB, first 20
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p --max-size 5MB --limit 20

# Videos in range, 10-100MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v --min-id 100 --max-id 200 --min-size 10MB --max-size 100MB

# Everything except videos, under 50MB
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -a -d --max-size 50MB

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Learn about message ID ranges
  • See advanced usage examples
  • Full command reference
  • Troubleshooting common issues

docs.title: Message ID Ranges
docs.text: Complete guide to downloading specific message ranges from Telegram entities.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Message ID ranges allow you to download specific portions of a channel, group, or bot chat by specifying start and end message IDs.

Benefits: - Download only what you need - Re-download specific sections - Skip old or irrelevant content - Manage large archives efficiently - Targeted backup strategies

docs.title: What are Message IDs?
docs.text:
Every message in a Telegram chat has a unique sequential ID number.

Message ID 1  ← First message (oldest)
Message ID 2
Message ID 3
...
Message ID N  ← Latest message (newest)

Key points: - IDs start at 1 - IDs increment by 1 for each message - IDs are unique within each entity (channel/group/bot) - IDs never change - Deleted messages leave gaps

docs.title: Method 1: From Telegram Desktop
docs.text:
1. Right-click on a message
  2. Select "Copy Message Link"
  3. Link format: https://t.me/channel/12345
  4. The last number (12345) is the message ID

Public channel example: 

https://t.me/technews/12345
                      └─┬──┘
                    message ID

Private channel example: 

https://t.me/c/1234567890/54321
                       └───┬──┘
                      message ID

docs.title: Method 2: From Downloaded Files
docs.text:
tgdl names files with message ID:

ls downloads/entity_1234567890/
# Output:
# 12345.jpg    ← Message ID is 12345
# 12346.mp4    ← Message ID is 12346
# 12347.pdf    ← Message ID is 12347

docs.title: Method 3: Using download-link
docs.text:
# Download single message to see its ID
tgdl download-link https://t.me/channel/12345

# Check downloaded file
ls downloads/
# Output: 12345.ext

docs.title: Method 4: From Telegram Mobile
docs.text:
1. Long-press message
  2. Tap "Forward"
  3. Forward to "Saved Messages"
  4. In Saved Messages, the forwarded message shows original date
  5. Use method 1 (copy link) from there

docs.title: Command Format
docs.text:
tgdl download -c|g|b ENTITY_ID --min-id MIN --max-id MAX

Parameters: - --min-id - Start from this message ID (inclusive) - --max-id - Stop at this message ID (inclusive) - Both are optional - Can use one or both

docs.title: Download Specific Range
docs.text:
# Messages 100 to 200 (inclusive)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200

This downloads messages: 100, 101, 102, ..., 199, 200

docs.title: From Specific ID Onwards
docs.text:
# From message 500 to latest
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 500

docs.title: Up to Specific ID
docs.text:
# From oldest to message 1000
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 1000

docs.title: Single Message
docs.text:
# Only message 12345
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 12345 --max-id 12345

docs.title: 1. Archive Historical Content
docs.text:
Scenario: Download old messages from a channel you just joined.

# First 1000 messages (historical archive)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 1000

Benefits: - Get old content without downloading everything - Separate old from new - Manage archive sizes

docs.title: 2. Get Recent Updates
docs.text:
Scenario: You've already downloaded messages 1-5000, now want 5000+.

# Everything after message 5000
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 5001

Alternative (automatic): 

# tgdl automatically tracks progress
tgdl download -c 1234567890
# Will download from last saved message ID

docs.title: 3. Re-download Failed Section
docs.text:
Scenario: Downloads failed for messages 2000-2100, want to retry.

# Re-download specific range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 2000 --max-id 2100

docs.title: 4. Download Specific Event/Period
docs.text:
Scenario: Know that interesting content was posted in messages 3000-3500.

# Download specific event range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 3000 --max-id 3500 -o ~/Events/Conference2024

docs.title: 5. Incremental Backups
docs.text:
Scenario: Create monthly backups with specific ranges.

# January (messages 1-1000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1 --max-id 1000 -o ~/Backups/2024-01

# February (messages 1001-2000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1001 --max-id 2000 -o ~/Backups/2024-02

# March (messages 2001-3000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 2001 --max-id 3000 -o ~/Backups/2024-03

docs.title: 6. Sample Downloads
docs.text:
Scenario: Want to see what's in different parts of a large channel.

# Sample early messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1 --max-id 50

# Sample middle
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 5000 --max-id 5050

# Sample recent
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 9900 --max-id 10000

docs.title: 7. Skip Unwanted Content
docs.text:
Scenario: Channel has spam/ads in messages 1000-2000, want to skip.

# Get messages before spam
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 999

# Get messages after spam
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 2001

docs.title: With Media Type Filters
docs.text:
# Videos in specific range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200 -v

# Photos from recent messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 9000 -p

docs.title: With Size Filters
docs.text:
# Large files in specific range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 500 --max-id 1000 --min-size 100MB

# Small photos from old messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 500 -p --max-size 5MB

docs.title: With Download Limit
docs.text:
# First 10 files from range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1000 --max-id 2000 --limit 10

Important: Limit applies AFTER range filter.

Example: - Range: 1000-2000 (1000 messages) - Has: 500 media files in range - Limit: 10 - Result: First 10 of those 500 media files

docs.title: Combined Example
docs.text:
# Recent videos, 50-100MB, max 20 files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 \
  --min-id 9000 \
  -v \
  --min-size 50MB \
  --max-size 100MB \
  --limit 20 \
  --concurrent 10

docs.title: Automatic Progress Tracking
docs.text:
tgdl automatically tracks the last downloaded message ID:

# First run
tgdl download -c 1234567890
# Downloads messages 1-1000
# Saves: {"1234567890": 1000} in progress.json

# Second run (later)
tgdl download -c 1234567890
# Reads progress.json
# Downloads messages 1001+ (new content only)

Manual override: 

# Force specific range (ignores progress)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1

docs.title: Finding Latest Message ID
docs.text:
Method 1: Download one message 

# Get latest message
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 1

# Check filename
ls downloads/entity_1234567890/
# Latest file shows latest message ID

Method 2: From Telegram app - Scroll to bottom of channel - Copy message link - Extract ID from link

docs.title: Batch Downloads by Range
docs.text:
Script example (Linux/macOS): 

#!/bin/bash

CHANNEL=1234567890
BATCH_SIZE=1000

for start in {1..10000..1000}; do
    end=$((start + BATCH_SIZE - 1))
    echo "Downloading messages $start to $end..."
    tgdl download -c $CHANNEL --min-id $start --max-id $end
    sleep 60  # Wait between batches
done

Script example (Windows PowerShell): 

$channel = 1234567890
$batchSize = 1000

for ($start = 1; $start -le 10000; $start += $batchSize) {
    $end = $start + $batchSize - 1
    Write-Host "Downloading messages $start to $end..."
    tgdl download -c $channel --min-id $start --max-id $end
    Start-Sleep -Seconds 60
}

docs.title: Gap Detection
docs.text:
Find missing downloads: 

#!/bin/bash

# List downloaded message IDs
ls downloads/entity_1234567890/ | sed 's/\..*//' | sort -n > downloaded.txt

# Check for gaps
prev=0
while read id; do
    if [ $((id - prev)) -gt 1 ]; then
        echo "Gap: $prev to $id"
    fi
    prev=$id
done < downloaded.txt

docs.title: Telethon's iter_messages()
docs.text:
tgdl uses Telethon's iter_messages() method:

async for message in client.iter_messages(
    entity,
    min_id=min_msg_id - 1,  # Subtract 1 for inclusive
    max_id=max_msg_id,
    reverse=False  # Newest first
):
    # Process message

Important details: - min_id is exclusive in Telethon - tgdl subtracts 1 to make it inclusive - max_id is already inclusive - Messages fetched newest to oldest (unless reverse=True)

Example: 

# User command
tgdl download -c ID --min-id 100 --max-id 200

# Internal Telethon call
iter_messages(entity, min_id=99, max_id=200)
# Returns messages 100, 101, ..., 199, 200

docs.title: Progress Tracking Logic
docs.text:
# 1. Read progress
last_id = progress.get(entity_id, 0)

# 2. Use as min_id if no explicit range
if not min_msg_id:
    min_msg_id = last_id + 1

# 3. Download messages
# ... download logic ...

# 4. Update progress with highest downloaded ID
progress[entity_id] = highest_downloaded_id
save_progress(progress)

docs.title: Empty Ranges
docs.text:
If range contains no media files:

tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200
# May download 0 files if range only has text messages

Check first: 

# Try with limit
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200 --limit 1

docs.title: Deleted Messages
docs.text:
Deleted messages leave gaps in IDs:

Message 10 ← Exists
Message 11 ← Deleted (gap)
Message 12 ← Exists

Impact: - No errors - Simply skipped (not counted) - Range 10-12 downloads messages 10 and 12 only

docs.title: Large Ranges
docs.text:
Very large ranges may take long:

# Inefficient: Checking 100,000 messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1 --max-id 100000 -v

Better approach: 

# Use limit if you don't need all
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1 --max-id 100000 -v --limit 100

docs.title: Range vs Limit Interaction
docs.text:
Important:

# This does NOT mean "download 10 messages in range"
# It means "from messages in range, download first 10 media files"
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200 --limit 10

Execution: 1. Filter messages: 100-200 2. Filter media: Only messages with media 3. Apply limit: First 10

docs.title: No files downloaded from range
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  1. No media in range: 

    # Check without media filters
tgdl download -c ID --min-id 100 --max-id 200 --limit 1

  2. All files already downloaded:

  3. Normal behavior

  4. tgdl skips existing files

  5. Range beyond channel size: 

    # If channel only has 1000 messages
tgdl download -c ID --min-id 2000 --max-id 3000
# Downloads 0 files

docs.title: Wrong range downloaded
docs.text:
Check command: 

# Make sure IDs are correct
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200

Verify: 

# Check downloaded filenames
ls downloads/entity_1234567890/
# Should see 100.ext, 101.ext, etc.

docs.title: Progress tracking interferes
docs.text:
Progress takes precedence: 

# progress.json has: {"1234567890": 5000}

# This command
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 200

# Actually downloads from 5001 (progress overrides)

Solution - reset progress for that entity: 

# Edit progress.json, remove entity or set to 0
# OR force specific range by ensuring max-id > progress

docs.title: Beginner Examples
docs.text:
# Download first 100 messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 100

# Download last 100 messages (if latest is 10000)
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 9900

# Download single message
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 12345 --max-id 12345

docs.title: Intermediate Examples
docs.text:
# Videos from specific range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1000 --max-id 2000 -v

# Photos under 5MB from old messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-id 500 -p --max-size 5MB

# Recent large files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 9000 --min-size 50MB

docs.title: Advanced Examples
docs.text:
# HD videos from conference messages
tgdl download -c 1234567890 \
  --min-id 3000 \
  --max-id 3500 \
  -v \
  --min-size 100MB \
  --max-size 500MB \
  -o ~/Conferences/2024/Videos

# Sample every 1000 messages
for i in {0..10000..1000}; do
  tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id $i --max-id $((i+10))
done

# Batch download with error handling
#!/bin/bash
for start in {1..10000..500}; do
    end=$((start + 499))
    if ! tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id $start --max-id $end; then
        echo "Failed: $start-$end" >> failed_ranges.txt
    fi
    sleep 60
done

docs.title: 1. Test with Small Range
docs.text:
Test First

# Test with 10-message range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 110

# If successful, expand range
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 100 --max-id 1000

docs.title: 2. Use Appropriate Batch Sizes
docs.text:
Batch Strategy

  • Small files: 1000-5000 messages per batch
  • Large files: 100-500 messages per batch
  • Very large files: 50-100 messages per batch

docs.title: 3. Combine with Filters
docs.text:
Efficient Filtering

# Instead of downloading everything then filtering
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --min-id 1000 --max-id 2000 -v --max-size 100MB

docs.title: 4. Monitor Progress
docs.text:
Track Progress

# Check progress file
cat ~/.tgdl/progress.json

# Backup before major operations
cp ~/.tgdl/progress.json ~/.tgdl/progress.backup

docs.title: 5. Handle Errors Gracefully
docs.text:
Error Handling

# Script with retry logic
#!/bin/bash
for attempt in {1..3}; do
    if tgdl download -c ID --min-id 1000 --max-id 2000; then
        break
    fi
    echo "Attempt $attempt failed, retrying..."
    sleep 60
done

docs.title: Command Template
docs.text: tgdl download -c|g|b ID [--min-id MIN] [--max-id MAX] [OPTIONS]

docs.title: Common Patterns
docs.text:
# From ID onwards
--min-id ID

# Up to ID
--max-id ID

# Specific range
--min-id START --max-id END

# Single message
--min-id ID --max-id ID

# With filters
--min-id ID --max-id ID -v --max-size 100MB --limit 50

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Learn about media filters
  • Explore advanced usage
  • See full command reference
  • Troubleshooting

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text: Get up and running with tgdl in just 5 minutes!

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • ✅ Installed tgdl
  • ✅ Obtained API credentials
  • ✅ Your Telegram phone number

docs.title: Step 1: Login to Telegram
docs.text:
Run the login command:

tgdl login

You'll be prompted for:

  1. API ID - Your numeric API identifier
  2. API Hash - Your secret API hash
  3. Phone number - With country code (e.g., +1234567890)
  4. Verification code - Sent to your Telegram app
  5. 2FA password - If you have two-factor authentication enabled

docs.title: Example Login Session
docs.text:
$ tgdl login

🔐 Telegram Login
Get your API credentials from: https://my.telegram.org/apps

Telegram API ID: 12345678
Telegram API Hash: 0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef
Phone number (with country code): +1234567890

Sending verification code to +1234567890...

Enter the verification code you received: 12345

✓ Successfully logged in as John Doe (ID: 123456789)

✓ Session saved successfully!
You can now use other tgdl commands.

Two-Factor Authentication

If you have 2FA enabled, you'll be prompted for your password after entering the verification code.

docs.title: Step 2: List Your Channels/Groups
docs.text: Check what's available to download:

docs.title: List Channels
docs.text:
tgdl channels

Output: 

📢 Fetching your channels...

📢 Found 3 channels:

ID              Title                                    Username            
===============================================================================
1234567890      Tech News Daily                          @technews           
9876543210      Photography World                        N/A                 
5555555555      Movies & TV                              @moviesandtv        

💡 Tip: Use 'tgdl download -c <ID>' to download from a channel

docs.title: List Groups
docs.text: tgdl groups

docs.title: List Bot Chats
docs.text: tgdl bots

docs.title: Step 3: Download Media
docs.text: Now you're ready to download!

docs.title: Basic Download (All Media)
docs.text:
Download everything from a channel:

tgdl download -c 1234567890

docs.title: Download with Confirmation
docs.text:
📥 Download Settings
  Entity: Channel 1234567890
  Media types: all
  Parallel downloads: 5
  Output: downloads

💡 Tip: Files already downloaded will be skipped automatically
⚠️  Press Ctrl+C to cancel at any time

Continue with download? [Y/n]: y
Fetching messages from entity 1234567890...
Found 125 media files to download

Downloading: 100%|████████████████████| 125/125 [02:15<00:00,  1.08s/file]

✓ Successfully downloaded 125 files!
Files saved to: F:\Downloads\entity_1234567890

docs.title: Download Only Videos
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v

docs.title: Download Photos and Videos
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 -p -v

docs.title: Download with Size Limit
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 100MB

docs.title: Download First 50 Files
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 50

docs.title: Fast Download (10 parallel)
docs.text: tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 10

docs.title: Download Progress
docs.text:
Fetching messages from entity 1234567890...
Found 125 media files to download

Downloading: 45%|█████████░░░░░░░░░░░| 56/125 [01:02<01:13,  1.11s/file]
  • Progress bar - Visual download progress
  • Current/Total - Files downloaded so far
  • Time elapsed - How long it's been running
  • Time remaining - Estimated time to completion
  • Speed - Files per second

docs.title: Success Message
docs.text:
✓ Successfully downloaded 125 files!
Files saved to: F:\Downloads\entity_1234567890

Your files are saved in the downloads/entity_<ID> folder.

docs.title: File Organization
docs.text:
Downloaded files are organized like this:

downloads/
├── entity_1234567890/          # Channel 1
│   ├── 12345.jpg
│   ├── 12346.mp4
│   └── 12347.pdf
├── entity_9876543210/          # Channel 2
│   ├── 98765.jpg
│   └── 98766.png
└── single_downloads/           # Individual link downloads
    └── file_123.mp4

File Naming

Files are named with their message ID for reliable tracking and duplicate prevention.

docs.title: Automatic Skip
docs.text:
Already downloaded files are automatically skipped:

Found 25 already downloaded files, will skip...
Fetching messages from entity 1234567890...
Found 10 new media files to download

docs.title: Resume Support
docs.text:
If interrupted, just run the command again:

# Download starts again
tgdl download -c 1234567890

tgdl will: - ✅ Skip already downloaded files - ✅ Continue from where it stopped - ✅ Only download new media

docs.title: Progress Tracking
docs.text:
tgdl remembers what it downloaded:

  • Each entity's progress is tracked separately
  • Next time you run download, only NEW messages are fetched
  • Efficient for keeping media collections up-to-date

docs.title: Quick Reference Card
docs.text: Task Command Login tgdl login Logout tgdl logout List channels tgdl channels List groups tgdl groups List bots tgdl bots Download all tgdl download -c ID Download videos tgdl download -c ID -v Download photos tgdl download -c ID -p With size limit tgdl download -c ID --max-size 100MB Fast download tgdl download -c ID --concurrent 10 Check status tgdl status

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text:
While downloading:

  • Ctrl+C - Cancel download (can resume later)
  • Progress is automatically saved

docs.title: Tips for Beginners
docs.text:
Start Small

For your first download, use --limit 10 to download just 10 files and see how it works.

Check Storage

Large channels can have gigabytes of media. Check available disk space first.

Use Filters

Instead of downloading everything, use filters like -v (videos only) or --max-size to save space.

Increase Speed

Default is 5 parallel downloads. For faster downloads, try --concurrent 10 or even --concurrent 20.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you know the basics:

  1. Learn all commands
  2. Explore advanced usage
  3. Use media filters
  4. Download message ranges

You're All Set!

You now know enough to start downloading media from Telegram. Explore the advanced features when you're ready!

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Solutions to common issues and error messages.

docs.title: pip install fails
docs.text:
Symptom: 

ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tgdl

Solutions:

  1. Update pip: 

    # Linux/macOS
python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip

# Windows
python -m pip install --upgrade pip

  2. Check Python version: 

    python --version  # Should be 3.7+

  3. Try with python3: 

    python3 -m pip install tgdl

docs.title: Import errors on Ubuntu/Debian
docs.text:
Symptom: 

ImportError: cannot import name 'PBKDF2' from 'cryptography.hazmat.primitives.kdf.pbkdf2'

Solution:

Update cryptography: 

pip install --upgrade cryptography

Or reinstall tgdl: 

pip install --force-reinstall tgdl

docs.title: Permission denied
docs.text:
Symptom: 

PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied

Solution:

Install in user directory: 

pip install --user tgdl

Or use virtual environment (recommended): 

python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/macOS
# venv\Scripts\activate   # Windows
pip install tgdl

docs.title: Invalid phone number
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: PHONE_NUMBER_INVALID

Solutions:

  1. Include country code: 

    ✗ Wrong: 1234567890
✓ Correct: +11234567890

  2. No spaces or dashes: 

    ✗ Wrong: +1 123-456-7890
✓ Correct: +11234567890

  3. Verify number is registered:

  4. Check you can login to Telegram app with this number

docs.title: Verification code issues
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: PHONE_CODE_INVALID

Solutions:

  1. Check for typos:
  2. Code is usually 5 digits

  3. No spaces

  4. Don't wait too long:

  5. Code expires after ~10 minutes

  6. Request new code if expired

  7. Check Telegram app:

  8. Code appears in Telegram app (Telegram service message)

  9. Not SMS (usually)

  10. Try SMS code:

  11. Wait for SMS if app code doesn't work
  12. Check spam folder

docs.title: Two-factor authentication error
docs.text:
Symptom: 

SessionPasswordNeededError

Solution:

  1. tgdl will prompt for 2FA password: 

    Enter 2FA password:

  2. If you forgot password:

  3. Reset via Telegram app
  4. Settings → Privacy and Security → Two-Step Verification

  5. Reset password (requires recovery email)

  6. If you don't have 2FA:

  7. This error shouldn't appear
  8. May indicate account security issue

docs.title: Session expired
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: Session expired or invalid

Solutions:

  1. Logout and login again: 

    tgdl logout
tgdl login

  2. Remove session manually: 

    # Linux/macOS
rm ~/.tgdl/tgdl.session*

# Windows
del %USERPROFILE%\.tgdl\tgdl.session*

Then login again: 

tgdl login

  1. Check API credentials: 
    tgdl status
  2. Verify API ID and Hash are correct

docs.title: Could not find input entity
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: Could not find the input entity for PeerUser

Solutions:

  1. For channels/groups - verify you're a member: 

    # List your channels
tgdl channels

# Check if channel ID is listed

  2. Join the channel:

  3. Open Telegram app
  4. Join the channel/group
  5. Wait a few seconds

  6. Try download again

  7. Use correct entity ID:

  8. From tgdl channels output

  9. Not from web URL (use different format)

  10. For private channels: 

    # Use channel ID from tgdl channels
tgdl download -c 1234567890

# NOT from web URL

docs.title: No files downloaded
docs.text:
Symptom: 

⚠ No files downloaded.

Possible Causes & Solutions:

  1. Channel has no media: 
    # Check with limit
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

  2. If still zero, channel may only have text

  3. Filters too restrictive: 

    # Try without filters
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

# If this works, adjust filters

  4. All files already downloaded: 

    # Check output for:
Found 50 already downloaded files, will skip...
Found 0 new media files to download

  5. This is normal (no new content)

  6. Wrong entity type: 

    # If it's a group, use -g not -c
tgdl download -g 1234567890

  7. Message ID range issue: 

    # Try without range limits
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 5

docs.title: Download interrupted
docs.text:
Symptom: 

^C
⚠ Download cancelled by user.

Solution:

Run the same command again - tgdl will resume: 

tgdl download -c 1234567890

Already downloaded files are automatically skipped.

docs.title: Slow download speed
docs.text:
Possible Causes & Solutions:

  1. Network speed limitation:
  2. Check internet speed

  3. Large files take time

  4. Too many concurrent downloads: 

    # Reduce concurrent count
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 3

  5. Telegram server limitations:

  6. Normal during peak hours

  7. Try different time of day

  8. Large file sizes: 

    # Check file sizes
ls -lh downloads/entity_1234567890/

# Filter smaller files
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 50MB

docs.title: Connection timeout
docs.text:
Symptom: 

TimeoutError: Connection timed out

Solutions:

  1. Check internet connection: 

    ping telegram.org

  2. Retry: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890

  3. Already downloaded files will be skipped

  4. Reduce concurrent downloads: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 3

  5. Check firewall/proxy:

  6. Telegram may be blocked
  7. Try VPN if in restricted region

docs.title: FloodWaitError
docs.text:
Symptom: 

FloodWaitError: A wait of 300 seconds is required

Cause: Too many requests to Telegram

Solutions:

  1. Wait the specified time: 

    # Wait 300 seconds (5 minutes)
sleep 300
tgdl download -c 1234567890

  2. Reduce concurrent downloads: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 2

  3. Download in smaller batches: 

    # Use limit to control batch size
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 50
# Wait between batches
sleep 300
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 50

  4. Avoid rapid repeated requests:

  5. Don't run multiple tgdl instances
  6. Add delays in scripts

docs.title: Duplicate downloads
docs.text:
Symptom: Files being re-downloaded despite "skipping" message

Solution:

This should be fixed in version 1.1.4+. If you're experiencing this:

  1. Update tgdl: 

    pip install --upgrade tgdl

  2. Check version: 

    pip show tgdl

  3. If issue persists:

  4. Report as bug on GitHub
  5. Include: tgdl version, command used, output

docs.title: Cannot create directory
docs.text:
Symptom: 

PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/path/to/downloads'

Solutions:

  1. Use different output directory: 

    # User's home directory
tgdl download -c 1234567890 -o ~/tgdl_downloads

  2. Check directory permissions: 

    # Linux/macOS
ls -ld downloads/
chmod 755 downloads/

  3. Run without sudo:

  4. Don't use sudo with tgdl
  5. Use user directory instead

docs.title: Cannot write file
docs.text:
Symptom: 

PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: 'downloads/12345.jpg'

Solutions:

  1. Check available disk space: 

    # Linux/macOS
df -h

# Windows
dir

  2. Check file already exists: 

    ls -l downloads/entity_1234567890/12345.jpg

  3. Delete if corrupted

  4. Change output directory: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 -o ~/Downloads

docs.title: Invalid API credentials
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: API_ID_INVALID

Solutions:

  1. Verify credentials:
  2. Go to https://my.telegram.org/apps

  3. Check API ID and Hash

  4. Re-enter credentials: 

    tgdl logout
tgdl login

  5. Enter correct API ID and Hash

  6. Check for typos:

  7. API ID: numbers only
  8. API Hash: 32 character alphanumeric string

docs.title: API credentials not found
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: API credentials not found

Solution:

Login first: 

tgdl login

This will prompt for API credentials.

docs.title: Files not named correctly
docs.text:
Symptom: Files named generically (photo.jpg) instead of with message ID

This is expected for: - Old versions (pre-1.1.0) - Single file downloads via download-link

For regular downloads: - Should be named: {message_id}.{extension} - Example: 12345.jpg

If incorrect: 1. Update tgdl: 

pip install --upgrade tgdl

  1. Re-download: 
    tgdl download -c 1234567890

docs.title: Corrupted files
docs.text:
Symptom: Files won't open or are incomplete

Solutions:

  1. Check file size: 
    ls -lh downloads/entity_1234567890/

  2. Very small files (< 1KB) may be corrupted

  3. Delete and re-download: 

    # Delete corrupted file
rm downloads/entity_1234567890/12345.jpg

# Re-download (tgdl will get missing files)
tgdl download -c 1234567890

  4. Check disk space:

  5. Insufficient space can cause corruption

  6. Download interrupted:

  7. Run download again to resume

docs.title: Config file not found
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: Configuration file not found

Solution:

Login to create config: 

tgdl login

docs.title: Cannot read config file
docs.text:
Symptom: 

✗ Error: Cannot read configuration file

Solutions:

  1. Check file permissions: 

    # Linux/macOS
ls -l ~/.tgdl/config.json
chmod 600 ~/.tgdl/config.json

  2. Reset configuration: 

    # Backup first
cp ~/.tgdl/config.json ~/.tgdl/config.json.backup

# Logout and login again
tgdl logout
tgdl login

  3. Manually remove config: 

    # Linux/macOS
rm ~/.tgdl/config.json
rm ~/.tgdl/.key

# Windows
del %USERPROFILE%\.tgdl\config.json
del %USERPROFILE%\.tgdl\.key

# Login again
tgdl login

docs.title: Progress not saved
docs.text:
Symptom: Downloads start from beginning each time

Solutions:

  1. Check progress file: 

    # Linux/macOS
cat ~/.tgdl/progress.json

# Windows
type %USERPROFILE%\.tgdl\progress.json

  2. Verify file permissions: 

    # Linux/macOS
ls -l ~/.tgdl/progress.json
chmod 644 ~/.tgdl/progress.json

  3. Reset progress: 

    # Backup first
cp ~/.tgdl/progress.json ~/.tgdl/progress.json.backup

# Reset
echo "{}" > ~/.tgdl/progress.json

docs.title: Wrong progress tracking
docs.text:
Symptom: Downloads skip files that weren't downloaded

Solutions:

  1. Check progress file: 
    cat ~/.tgdl/progress.json

  2. Shows last downloaded message ID per entity

  3. Reset progress for entity: 

    # Edit progress.json
# Remove entry for entity ID

  4. Or reset all progress: 

    echo "{}" > ~/.tgdl/progress.json
tgdl download -c 1234567890

docs.title: Command not found
docs.text:
Symptom: 

tgdl: command not found

Solutions:

  1. Check installation: 

    pip show tgdl

  2. Add to PATH: 

    # Linux/macOS - add to ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
source ~/.bashrc

# Windows - pip should handle this automatically

  3. Use python -m: 

    python -m tgdl login

  4. Reinstall: 

    pip uninstall tgdl
pip install tgdl

docs.title: Invalid command/option
docs.text:
Symptom: 

Error: No such option: --xyz

Solutions:

  1. Check help: 

    tgdl --help
tgdl download --help

  2. Verify spelling: 

    ✗ Wrong: --max_size
✓ Correct: --max-size

  3. Check command structure: 

    # Correct order
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 100MB

# Wrong order
tgdl --max-size 100MB download -c 1234567890

docs.title: Windows: PowerShell encoding issues
docs.text:
Symptom: Unicode characters display incorrectly

Solution:

Set UTF-8 encoding: 

[Console]::OutputEncoding = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8

Add to PowerShell profile to make permanent: 

notepad $PROFILE

docs.title: Linux: SSL certificate errors
docs.text:
Symptom: 

SSLError: certificate verify failed

Solutions:

  1. Update certificates: 

    # Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install ca-certificates

# Fedora
sudo dnf update ca-certificates

  2. Update Python certifi: 

    pip install --upgrade certifi

docs.title: macOS: notarization warnings
docs.text:
Symptom: Security warnings when running tgdl

Solution:

This shouldn't happen with pip installations. If it does:

# Reinstall
pip uninstall tgdl
pip install tgdl

docs.title: High memory usage
docs.text:
Symptom: System slows down during download

Solutions:

  1. Reduce concurrent downloads: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 --concurrent 2

  2. Download in smaller batches: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 50

  3. Close other applications:

  4. Free up RAM

  5. Close browser tabs

  6. Check system resources: 

    # Linux
top

# macOS
top

# Windows
Task Manager

docs.title: High disk usage
docs.text:
Symptom: Disk space fills up quickly

Solutions:

  1. Use size limits: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 --max-size 50MB

  2. Use download limits: 

    tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 100

  3. Check available space first: 

    df -h  # Linux/macOS

  4. Clean old downloads: 

    # Remove files older than 30 days
find downloads -type f -mtime +30 -delete

docs.title: Check logs
docs.text:
Download logs: 

tgdl download -c 1234567890 > download.log 2>&1
cat download.log

System info: 

# Python version
python --version

# tgdl version
pip show tgdl

# OS info
uname -a  # Linux/macOS
systeminfo  # Windows

docs.title: Report bugs
docs.text:
On GitHub: https://github.com/kavidu-dilhara/tgdl/issues

Include: 1. tgdl version (pip show tgdl) 2. Python version (python --version) 3. Operating system 4. Full error message 5. Command you ran 6. Expected vs actual behavior

docs.title: Ask for help
docs.text:
Provide: - What you're trying to do - What command you ran - Full error message (if any) - What you've tried so far

Example: 

I'm trying to download videos from a channel but getting zero files.

Command: tgdl download -c 1234567890 -v
Output: ⚠ No files downloaded.

I can see the channel has videos in Telegram app.
I've tried without filters and still get zero files.

tgdl version: 1.1.4
Python version: 3.9.7
OS: Ubuntu 22.04

docs.title: Checklist for issues:
docs.text:
• Latest tgdl version? (pip install --upgrade tgdl)
  • Python 3.7+? (python --version)
  • Logged in? (tgdl status)
  • Member of channel/group?
  • Correct entity flag (-c/-g/-b)?
  • Internet connection working?
  • Enough disk space?
  • Correct API credentials?

docs.title: Common fixes:
docs.text:
# Update tgdl
pip install --upgrade tgdl

# Reset session
tgdl logout
tgdl login

# Test with minimal command
tgdl download -c 1234567890 --limit 3

# Check status
tgdl status
